question:
Consider the following differences between Geographical indications (GIs) and Trademark:
  1. While GIs identify a good based on its originating place, trademark identifies it based on origin from a particular company
  2. While development of trademark is linked to human creativity, GIs are linked to topography independent of human creativity
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
Differences between trademark and GIs are:
  • GIs identify a good based on its originating place; trademark identifies it based on origin from a particular company.
  • Trademark provides protection to the owner of the mark by ensuring the exclusive right to use it to identify goods or services, while the protection of Geographical indications is enjoyed by all traders from a particular geographical location.
  • The development of trademark is linked to human creativity; GIs are linked to topography independent of human creativity.
  • A trademark is used to distinguish the products of a specific trader from those of its competitors, Geographical indications are by definition generic descriptions because a geographic name denotes the geographical origin.
